etymologies: late 19th century. From centro- + -ode; with the semantic motivation, compare the etymological comment in quot. 1878

definitions: The path described by the instantaneous centre of rotation of a body moving in a plane.

notes.text: "space centrode" noun the path described by the instantaneous centre of rotation relative to a fixed plane; also called "fixed centrode". "body centrode" noun the path described by the instantaneous centre of rotation relative to the motion of the body; also called "moving centrode".
